title: Marsh - Billings - Rockefeller National Historical Park: Burmese Watercolors
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     Collections     Online Exhibits     Burmese Watercolors                  Burmese Watercolors       Burmese Watercolors These watercolors were most likely purchased by the Billings Family in Burma during their 1898 trip to the Far East. On the back of the first painting (MABI 9309), Mrs. Billings wrote the title, "Duel on Elephants." On the second painting (MABI 9308), she wrote the title "Theebaw on his Elephant." King Thibaw (sometimes spelled Theebaw) was the last king of Burma. He was exiled to India when the British deposed him in 1885, where he remained for the rest of his life       MABI 9309 “Duel on Elephants”          MABI 9308 "Theebaw on his Elephant”
